required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Combined Resistance and Aerobic Exercise Training on Obesity in Adolescent Girls

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study was to observe therapeutic effects of combined resistance and aerobic exercise training (CRAE) on hyperinsulemia in obese adolescent girls. Forty obese adolescent girls (14Â±1 years) participated in this study. The participants were randomly separated into two groups; no-exercise group (n=20) and exercise group (n=20). The exercise group performed 12 weeks of CRAE.

primary_outcome.description: Height was measured before and after the training.
Weight was measured before and after the training.
BMI was calculated with weight and height before and after the training.
Body fat was measured before and after the training.
Lean body mass was measured before and after the training.
Waist circumference was measured before and after the training.

primary_outcome.measure: Glucose levels in millimole per liter
primary_outcome.description: Glucose levels were measured before and after the training from the blood.

primary_outcome.measure: Insulin levels in micro unit per milliliter
primary_outcome.description: Insulin levels were measured before and after the training from blood.

primary_outcome.measure: Homeostasis model assessment of Insulin Resistance (HOMA-IR)
primary_outcome.description: HOMA-IR was calculated before and after the training.

primary_outcome.measure: Leptin levels in nano grams per milliliter
primary_outcome.description: Leptin levels were measured before and after the training.

primary_outcome.measure: Adiponectin levels in micro grams per milliliter
primary_outcome.description: Adiponectin levels were measured before and after the training.

secondary_outcome.description: Systolic Blood Pressure (mmHg), Diastolic Blood Pressure (mmHg)

arm_group.description: Twenty obese adolescent girls. This arm did not perform any exercise training for 12 weeks.
Twenty obese adolescent girls. This arm performed combined exercise training 3 times a week for 12 weeks.

intervention.description: The combined exercise training were consisted with 5 minutes of warm-up, 20 minutes of resistant band exercises (Upper: seated rows, biceps curl, shoulder flexion, elbow flexion, pushup; Lower: hip flexion, hip extension, calf raise, leg press, squat), 30 minutes of treadmill walking, and 5 minutes of cool-down. Intensity of the training was gradually increased from 40-50% heart rate reserve in 1-4 weeks to 60-70% HRR in 9-12 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Obese with Hyperinsulinemia
- Obese with Abdominal obesity
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hypertension
- Pregnancy
- Chronic diseases
- Weight loss diet within the last 6 months
